meanings.definition: A type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, characterized by an abnormal increase in white blood cells.
meanings.sent1: Leucemia can make you feel very tired and sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with leucemia after the blood test.
meanings.sent3: Even though it sounds funny, leucemia is a serious illness.
meanings.sent4: To fight leucemia, one must be as strong as a warrior.
meanings.sent5: The image of leucemia invading the body is frightening.

meanings.definition: The presence of an abnormally large number of white blood cells in the blood, often leading to symptoms such as fatigue and frequent infections.
meanings.sent1: Leucemia can cause frequent infections due to too many white blood cells.
meanings.sent2: The symptoms of leucemia include fatigue and weakness.
meanings.sent3: Despite its name, leucemia doesn't make you turn white like a ghost.
meanings.sent4: In a way, leucemia turns the body into a battleground of white blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the dangers of leucemia with a vivid illustration.
